rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0001
rows.name: That turned out well!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0002
rows.name:
No matter how many times I see it,
resonating with a Blade is cool~

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0003
rows.name: Stop making me blush...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0004
rows.name:
Good, with our new ally on board,
let's find out what happened to Nia...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0005
rows.name: Don't be in such a hurry, Rex.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0006
rows.name: What now?

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0007
rows.name:
Since we're here,
we should get your Blade
properly equipped.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0008
rows.name:
You can enhance the weapon by buying a
Core Chip from that smithy over there.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0009
fev02_250_127_msg0010
rows.name:
The power difference
between using Core Chips
and not using them is enormous.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0011
rows.name: Okay, got it.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0012
rows.name: Now, onto the main point.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0013
rows.name: That over there is an Assist Core Shop.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0014
rows.name:
As someone without a Blade until now,
you probably never had a reason
to visit that shop, did you?

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0015
rows.name: That's right.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0016
rows.name:
I always wondered what that
odd-looking machine was for.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0017
rows.name:
It would be easier to understand
if we just go there and try it.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0101
rows.name:
Assist Cores serve to enhance
and support a Blade's abilities.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0102
rows.name:
There all different types! Some boost
defense, some make strong against
insects, or stronger at night-time, mo!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0103
rows.name:
However, how many Assist
Cores can be equipped
differs depending on the Blade.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0104
rows.name: I see.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0105
rows.name: Now here comes the crucial part...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0106
rows.name:
When you first get an Assist Core,
it's empty and completely useless.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0107
rows.name: So how do we change that...?

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0108
rows.name: Ah, now I understand!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0109
rows.name:
So that machine over there
is what makes Assist Cores functional.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0110
rows.name: You've got it exactly right.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0111
rows.name:
That's right. Feed collection items
into the unrefined Assist Cores,
and they'll become functional.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0112
rows.name:
You should try using
the Assist Core
I've been secretly keeping.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0113
rows.name:
How do you even hide things
in that tiny body of yours...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0114
rows.name:
...Oh yes, that's right.
You'll need some collection
items as well.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0115
rows.name:
You're keeping entirely
too many things hidden...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0116
rows.name:
Rex...
Let's try refining one now.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0117
rows.name: Got it!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0118
rows.name:
Once we finish this,
let's focus on finding
information about Nia!
